title: The Frozen River
opening: After defeating Arcard, Roy moved east deep into the frozen lands of Ilia.

Soon, they entered the thick forests that characterize Ilia’s central land. However, a general of Bern, Bishop Martel, was waiting for them with an ancient spell that was said to have been lost centuries ago…

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Bishop Martel! We have brought Lady Niime, as you asked.

intro.speaker: Martel
intro.line: Good. Let her pass.

intro.speaker: Niime
intro.line: What do you need from me?

intro.speaker: Martel
intro.line: Are you Niime, the Hermit on the Mountain?

intro.speaker: Niime
intro.line: So, some have begun calling me that, have they? Then I must be that Niime.

intro.speaker: Martel
intro.line: I hear that you are capable of using the ancient spell book that we found in this castle.

intro.speaker: Niime
intro.line: I should be able to. I’ve been studying the dark arts and ancient magic for decades now.

intro.speaker: Martel
intro.line: I understand that this spell can change the weather around the caster...

intro.speaker: Niime
intro.line: It wouldn’t be entirely improbable.

intro.speaker: Martel
intro.line: Then I order you. Use the spell book and create rainfall. Make it rain so that the rivers will overflow and push back the advancing Etrurian Army.

intro.speaker: Niime
intro.line: Well, I can try, but I frankly can’t guarantee that it will work. Also, powerful spells like these can only be cast once. Are you sure?

intro.speaker: Martel
intro.line: Silence! All you must do is follow my commands. You were the one who came to us and said you wished to join our forces. Then make yourself useful.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Princess Guinevere... We are getting closer to Bern.

intro.speaker: Guinevere
intro.line: ...Yes.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Since we are getting closer, we are clashing with soldiers from Bern more and more often. It will not be long before we engage in full combat with Bern.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: I wish to ask you something before we do.

intro.speaker: Guinevere
intro.line: What is that?

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: I have been hearing rumors...that King Zephiel rose to the throne because he murdered the former king.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: I couldn’t believe it. You tried to stop him even by casting away your nationality. If King Zephiel is such a mad individual as the rumors say, then why did you try so hard to find a peaceful way to end the war?

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Princess Guinevere, I accepted the Fire Emblem not to use it in battle, but to try and find a use for it to end this war peacefully.

intro.speaker: Guinevere
intro.line: Roy...

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Therefore, please tell me the truth about the rumors...

intro.speaker: Guinevere
intro.line: I...I’m sorry. Please...give me some time.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Princess!

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: ...What is the matter? Princess Guinevere was running off...

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: ...No, it’s nothing. Did you need something?

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: Yes, I have gathered some more information. We may have some trouble with this battle. A powerful dark magician by the name of Niime resides in the enemy ranks.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Dark magician... A Druid, probably.

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: She is apparently extremely learned in ancient sorcery. She has much more knowledge than any scholar could dream of.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: But we can’t pull back now.

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: No, but we can always be careful.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: I know. We must be wary.

battle.speaker: Niime
battle.line: ...I’m warning you for the last time. I really have no idea what will happen...

battle.speaker: Martel
battle.line: Just shut up and cast the spell!

battle.speaker: Roy
battle.line: An enemy spellcaster? Everyone, watch out!

battle.speaker: Martel
battle.line: What... What is this!? The rivers... The rivers have frozen over!

battle.speaker: Niime
battle.line: My, my... Now isn’t this a surprise...

battle.speaker: Martel
battle.line: ! You! You did this on purpose!

battle.speaker: Niime
battle.line: What are you talking about... I warned you that I couldn’t predict what would happen.

battle.speaker: Martel
battle.line: Quiet! Someone! Throw her into the dungeon!

battle.speaker: Merlinus
battle.line: Master Roy, we have a report. The rivers have apparently frozen over.

battle.speaker: Merlinus
battle.line: The ice is think enough for knights on horseback to cross them safely.

battle.speaker: Roy
battle.line: Oh... Well, good, we can advance more quickly now. Charge toward the castle gate!

boss.speaker: Martel
boss.line: Blast! How could you have traversed through this snow… Curse that useless hag!

boss.speaker: Martel
boss.line: No… I, one of the most intelligent of the generals…can die…?

end.speaker: Niime
end.line: Ah, finally I’ve been released from the clutches of Bern.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: You are?

end.speaker: Niime
end.line: My name is Niime. I live in the mountains and study arcane magic.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: You say you were released. Did you not join Bern out of your own will?

end.speaker: Niime
end.line: Well, I did, but it was only a guise. Bern’s army had something that I wanted to study.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: What is that?

end.speaker: Niime
end.line: The Dragons.

end.speaker: Niime
end.line: Well, well, that got you interested, didn’t it?

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: The Dragons you speak of... They are not the wyverns that Bern’s Dragon Knights ride, but the strange troops that are mixed in with Bern’s soldiers...

end.speaker: Niime
end.line: Exactly. Those are the Dragons that were supposedly defeated in the Scouring.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Why do you know this...?

end.speaker: Niime
end.line: I thought that this war was just another skirmish at first. But then I began to see strange...evil things among Bern’s troops, so I decided to investigate.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Were you able to find out anything?

end.speaker: Niime
end.line: The Dragons are indeed shrouded in mystery. I looked through many ancient books and scrolls, but I could only decipher so many of them. But...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: ...But?

end.speaker: Niime
end.line: I have come to believe that Bern has resurrected the Dark Dragon.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Dark Dragon... That is the leader of the Dragons that Hartmut defeated.

end.speaker: Niime
end.line: Right. Dragons are a much more advanced species then us humans. They have much greater vitality and intellect than us. However, there was one thing that the Dragons lagged far behind the humans in. The Dragons’ reproductive system was much less efficient than that of the humans. But even then, the Dark Dragon...it had the power to create more Dragons. That is what I learned from my research.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: It can make more Dragons...

end.speaker: Niime
end.line: The Dark Dragon can create more of its kind. That would explain where Bern has been getting all of its Dragons.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: That is possible.

end.speaker: Niime
end.line: Now, that being said... I want to learn more about the Dragons. Let me accompany your travels. I wield Dark Magic...I’m sure I can be of some assistance.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Of course. We want to learn about the Dragons as well. It may be dangerous, but it that’s okay with you, you’re welcome to join us.
